name: sync::mpmc::array::Channel::<T>::write

core::mem::MaybeUninit::<T>::new.doc:
Creates a new `MaybeUninit<T>` initialized with the given value.
 It is safe to call [`assume_init`] on the return value of this function.

 Note that dropping a `MaybeUninit<T>` will never call `T`'s drop code.
 It is your responsibility to make sure `T` gets dropped if it got initialized.

 # Example

 ```
 use std::mem::MaybeUninit;

 let v: MaybeUninit<Vec<u8>> = MaybeUninit::new(vec![42]);
 # // Prevent leaks for Miri
 # unsafe { let _ = MaybeUninit::assume_init(v); }
 ```

 [`assume_init`]: MaybeUninit::assume_init

core::ptr::mut_ptr::<impl *mut T>::write.doc:
Overwrites a memory location with the given value without reading or
 dropping the old value.

 See [`ptr::write`] for safety concerns and examples.

 [`ptr::write`]: crate::ptr::write()

core::sync::atomic::AtomicUsize::store.doc:
Stores a value into the atomic integer.

 `store` takes an [`Ordering`] argument which describes the memory ordering of this operation.
  Possible values are [`SeqCst`], [`Release`] and [`Relaxed`].

 # Panics

 Panics if `order` is [`Acquire`] or [`AcqRel`].

 # Examples

 ```


 some_var.store(10, Ordering::Relaxed);
 assert_eq!(some_var.load(Ordering::Relaxed), 10);
 ```

sync::mpmc::waker::SyncWaker::notify.doc: Attempts to find one thread (not the current one), select its operation, and wake it up.

doc: Writes a message into the channel.
